sn17.29:4.3: They cut through the outer skin, the inner skin, the flesh, sinews, and bones, until they reach the marrow and stay there.
sn17.29:5.1: Suppose a strong man was to twist a tough horse-hair rope around your shin and tighten it.
sn17.29:5.2: It would cut through the outer skin, the inner skin, the flesh, sinews, and bones, until it reached the marrow and stayed there.
sn17.29:5.3: In the same way, possessions, honor, and popularity cut through the outer skin, the inner skin, the flesh, sinews, and bones, until they reach the marrow and stay there.
sn17.29:5.4: That’s how brutal, bitter, and harsh are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”
